Tags: #Main #Analysis/Proofs #Course/FPM Continuity and Functional Limits Tags: #Definition #Analysis/Proofs #Course/FPM [!Definition]+ Def: Continuity Let $f$ be a real-valued function whose domain is a subset of $\R$.

Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Main #Course/FPM Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Notation #Course/FPM [!Notation]+ Ntn: Partition Intuitively, we often think of sets schematically as blobs containing elements, drawn as dots: For various reasons, often we want to partition this set into non-overlapping subsets, which we draw as ^239899

Tags: #Main #Analysis/Reals #Course/FPM [!Definition]+ Def: Definition of the Reals The definition of the Real numbers, denoted by $\R$ is built from 3 parts and defined by Axioms (rules that we take as a given and don’t need to prove)

Tags: #Main #Algebra/Groups #Course/FPM Groups Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Definition #Course/FPM [!Theorem]+ Thm: Defining a Group For any operation $\ast$, We say a non-empty set G is a group under $\ast$, or more formally that (G, $\ast$) is a group, if the following four axioms hold:
Tags: #Main #Analysis/Series #Course/FPM [!Definition]+ Def: Partial Sums of an Infinite Series Let $S = \dsumoinf a_k$ be an infinite series with terms $a_k$.
Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Theorem #Course/FPM [!Theorem]+ Thm: Lagrange’s Theorem Let $G$ be a finite group and let $H$ be a subgroup of $G$.

Tags: #Analysis/Proofs #Main #Course/FPM [!Definition]+ Thm: Proving a Sequence is Convergent A sequence of real numbers $(x_{n})$ is said to converge to a real number $L$ if for every $\epsilon>0$ there is $N\in\N$ (where $N$ usually depends on $\epsilon$) such that $$\text{for all } n\ge N\quad\text{we have that } \lvert x_{n}-L \rvert <\epsilon $$

Tags: #Collection #Analysis/Series #Course/FPM Tags: #Theorem #Analysis/Series #Course/FPM [!Theorem]+ Thm: Divergence Test If $(a_n)_{n\in\N}$ converges, then $a_n\to0$. If $(a_n)_{n\in\N}$ doesn’t converge to $0$, then $\dsumoinf a_n$ diverges.

Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Main #Course/Category_Theory Rings Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Definition #Course/Category_Theory [!Definition]+ Def: Definition of a Ring A ring is an algebraic structure that generalises fields.

Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Main #Course/Category_Theory Rings Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Definition #Course/Category_Theory [!Definition]+ Def: Definition of a Ring A ring is an algebraic structure that generalises fields.

Tags: #Algebra/Groups #Main #Course/FPM [!Definition]+ Def: Subgroup Let $G$ be a group. We say that a non-empty subset $H$ of $G$ is a subgroup of $G$ if $H$ itself is a group (under the operation from $G$).
